meanings.definition: To shape or form with a hammer.
meanings.sent1: The blacksmith was peining the hot metal into a horseshoe.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys peining the clay to create beautiful pottery.
meanings.sent3: The carpenter accidentally started peining the wood instead of sawing it.
meanings.sent4: The sculptor's hands moved swiftly, peining life into the lifeless metal.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic sound of peining echoed through the workshop.

meanings.definition: The act of shaping or forming with a hammer.
meanings.sent1: The peining of the metal required precision and strength.
meanings.sent2: He admired the intricate details of the peining on the iron gate.
meanings.sent3: The loud peining in the construction site could be heard from afar.
meanings.sent4: The artist's masterpiece featured delicate peining along the edges.
meanings.sent5: The ancient art of peining has been passed down through generations.
